long_desc.thetext:
This patch fixes a number of typos in the user-visible documentation.
I have separated out the logger file because there are some mis-spelt method names which need additional consideration.
Nick
Created attachment 738 Most of the changes

Created attachment 739 Typos in logger
This patch needs special attention because it renames method names.

Thanks Nick for this comprehensive patch, great! How did you do it (manually working through the JSdocs or some sort of tooling)?
I did apply the first patch (typos) to trunk (for 1.1) and branch_1_0_x (for 1.0.2), for the latter one as good as it matched. All was done in a few commits following r22062.
We decided to not correct the spelling issue in the logger methods this time, but in a future release.

fixed.
Separate bug report for loggers to be created.

If I did this regularly I'd find or develop some tools, but all I did this time was make the API documentation, concatenate all the JSON documentation files, clean up the resulting file and then run it through ispell/aspell, sorting and removing duplicates.
This file can be scanned visually very quickly for potential genuine typos.
The time-consuming bit is then visiting the code and deciding what the fix should be for each.
It's very satisfying!
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
